sub_topic: The Hénon map and its strange attractor
message_1:
Consider the Hénon map, given by the equations: 
xₙ₊₁ = yₙ + 1 - 1.4xₙ² 
yₙ₊₁ = 0.3xₙ 

Starting with the initial condition (x₀, y₀) = (1, 1), find the first three iterations (x₁, y₁), (x₂, y₂), and (x₃, y₃) of the Hénon map.
message_2:
To find the first three iterations of the Hénon map, we will use the given equations and the initial condition (x₀, y₀) = (1, 1).

Iteration 1:
x₁ = y₀ + 1 - 1.4x₀² = 1 + 1 - 1.4(1)² = 1 + 1 - 1.4 = 0.6
y₁ = 0.3x₀ = 0.3(1) = 0.3

Iteration 2:
x₂ = y₁ + 1 - 1.4x₁² = 0.3 + 1 - 1.4(0.6)² = 0.3 + 1 - 1.4(0.36) = 0.3 + 1 - 0.504 = 0.796
y₂ = 0.3x₁ = 0.3(0.6) = 0.18

Iteration 3:
x₃ = y₂ + 1 - 1.4x₂² = 0.18 + 1 - 1.4(0.796)² = 0.18 + 1 - 1.4(0.633616) = 0.18 + 1 - 0.8874624 = 0.2925376
y₃ = 0.3x₂ = 0.3(0.796) = 0.2388

So the first three iterations of the Hénon map are:
(x₁, y₁) = (0.6, 0.3)
(x₂, y₂) = (0.796, 0.18)
(x₃, y₃) = (0.2925376, 0.2388)
